content.question:
Listen to the excerpt.

A passing 64 chord is notated correctly above. The version that you hear has which of the following voice-leading errors?

choices.label: The fifth of the 64 chord is not doubled in the soprano.
The alto does not hold the common tone throughout.
The tenor motion is not stepwise throughout.
The bass motion is not stepwise throughout.

content.answer: The fifth of the 64 chord is not doubled in the soprano.

unit.text: 5: Harmony and Voice Leading II - Chord Progressions and Predominant Function

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Apply knowledge of musical symbols and terms to detect discrepancies in pitch and rhythm when comparing notated and performed music in one or two voices.
